00023 #ifndef __BMESH_ERROR_H__
00024 #define __BMESH_ERROR_H__
00025 
00030 /*----------- bmop error system ----------*/
00031 
00032 /* pushes an error onto the bmesh error stack.
00033  * if msg is null, then the default message for the errorcode is used.*/
00034 void BMO_error_raise(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *owner, int errcode, const char *msg);
00035 
00036 /* gets the topmost error from the stack.
00037  * returns error code or 0 if no error.*/
00038 int BMO_error_get(BMesh *bm, const char **msg, BMOperator **op);
00039 int BMO_error_occurred(BMesh *bm);
00040 
00041 /* same as geterror, only pops the error off the stack as well */
00042 int BMO_error_pop(BMesh *bm, const char **msg, BMOperator **op);
00043 void BMO_error_clear(BMesh *bm);
00044 
00045 /* this is meant for handling errors, like self-intersection test failures.
00046  * it's dangerous to handle errors in general though, so disabled for now. */
00047 
00048 /* catches an error raised by the op pointed to by catchop.
00049  * errorcode is either the errorcode, or BMERR_ALL for any
00050  * error.*/
00051 
00052 /* not yet implemented.
00053  * int BMO_error_catch_op(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *catchop, int errorcode, char **msg);
00054  */
00055 
00056 #define BM_ELEM_INDEX_VALIDATE(_bm, _msg_a, _msg_b) \
00057     BM_mesh_elem_index_validate(_bm, __FILE__ ":" STRINGIFY(__LINE__), __func__, _msg_a, _msg_b)
00058 
00059 /*------ error code defines -------*/
00060 
00061 /*error messages*/
00062 #define BMERR_SELF_INTERSECTING         1
00063 #define BMERR_DISSOLVEDISK_FAILED       2
00064 #define BMERR_CONNECTVERT_FAILED        3
00065 #define BMERR_WALKER_FAILED             4
00066 #define BMERR_DISSOLVEFACES_FAILED      5
00067 #define BMERR_DISSOLVEVERTS_FAILED      6
00068 #define BMERR_TESSELLATION              7
00069 #define BMERR_NONMANIFOLD               8
00070 #define BMERR_INVALID_SELECTION         9
00071 #define BMERR_MESH_ERROR                10
00072 
00073 /* BMESH_ASSERT */
00074 #ifdef WITH_ASSERT_ABORT
00075 #  define _BMESH_DUMMY_ABORT abort
00076 #else
00077 #  define _BMESH_DUMMY_ABORT() (void)0
00078 #endif
00079 
00080 /* this is meant to be higher level then BLI_assert(),
00081  * its enabled even when in Release mode*/
00082 #define BMESH_ASSERT(a)                                                       \
00083     (void)((!(a)) ?  (                                                        \
00084         (                                                                     \
00085         fprintf(stderr,                                                       \
00086             "BMESH_ASSERT failed: %s, %s(), %d at \'%s\'\n",                  \
00087             __FILE__, __func__, __LINE__, STRINGIFY(a)),                      \
00088         _BMESH_DUMMY_ABORT(),                                                 \
00089         NULL)) : NULL)
00090 
00091 #endif /* __BMESH_ERROR_H__ */
